title: Interchange the variables $$x$$ and $$y$$
speech: Replace , x  with  y  and then  y  with  x .

title: What's the equation after replacing $$x$$ with $$y$$ and $$y$$ with $$x$$
speech: x   is equal to   parentheses, 2 y minus 3,  raised to the 1 fifth power
pacedSpeech: , 2 y minus 3,  raised to the 1 fifth power

title: Solve for $$y$$
text: We can rise both sides to the fifth power then add $$3$$ both sides. It gives $$x^5+3=2y$$. Then we can isolate $$y$$ on one side by dividing by $$2$$ both sides which gives $$\frac{x^5+3}{2}=y$$. We can further simplify it into $$y$$ $$=\frac{1}{2} x^5$$ $$+\frac{3}{2}$$ which is the final answer.
speech: We can rise both sides to the fifth power then add  3  both sides. It gives  x to the fifth, plus 3 is equal to 2 y . Then we can isolate  y  on one side by dividing by  2  both sides which gives , fraction, x to the fifth plus 3, over 2,  is equal to, y . We can further simplify it into  y  , is equal to 1 half x to the fifth,   positive 3 halves  which is the final answer.
